summary: This is a forensic analysis report from the FBI's Forensic Hardware and Software unit, detailing the examination of two desktop computers used by guards at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The analysis was requested to investigate allegations of falsified records and failure to check on inmates related to the suicide of Jeffrey Epstein. The report confirms the forensic procedures were sound and the results are reproducible.

persons.name: Brad Leonard
persons.context: Appears as the examiner or primary contact name for the forensic case (Case Reference IDMS Reference Examiner). The case background references an 'Allegation of BOP Falsification of records... related to the suicide of J EPSTEIN'.

persons.name: J Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the forensic analysis was initiated due to allegations related to the falsification of records and failure to check on inmates surrounding his suicide.

connections.description: Leonard is the examiner on the forensic case analyzing guard computers related to the events surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, which prompted the investigation into guard conduct and record falsification.

events.title: Case Opened for Forensic Analysis
events.description: The forensic case (2019-010614) was opened to analyze desktops used by guards for timeline and event analysis related to user activity around the time of Epstein's death.

events.title: Forensic Review Completed
events.description: The technical review of the forensic examination was completed and approved, confirming the procedures were sound and the report was clear.

events.title: Evidence Collection - HP EliteDesk
events.description: The HP EliteDesk 800 computer (S/N: 2UA4381XJW) was logged in and imaged as evidence. This was one of the guard desktops analyzed.

events.title: Evidence Collection - HP Compaq
events.description: The HP Compaq 8200 Elite computer (S/N: MXL14700DY) was imaged as evidence. This was the second guard desktop analyzed.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (implied location of the incident and guard computers)
keyFacts: The document is a forensic report analyzing two desktop computers (HP EliteDesk 800 and HP Compaq 8200 Elite) used by guards at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The analysis was specifically requested to investigate allegations that Bureau of Prisons (BOP) personnel falsified records and failed to check on inmates in relation to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.
The forensic examination was deemed forensically sound, adequately documented, and its conclusions were found to be reasonable and reproducible by the reviewer.
The case was linked to a related investigation (LIMA Case #0384).
The report confirms the evidence (computers) was collected and analyzed to establish a timeline of user activity around the time of Epstein's death.
